entry.title: [Grid] Introduce caching of a subgrid's intrinsic block size
entry.content:
Similar to CL:5171270, this change introduces caching of the intrinsic

block size to be reused within the same step of the sizing algorithm.



Removing `InvalidateCachedMinMaxSizes` in favor of invalidating the

intrinsic sizes cache in `InitializeTrackSizes`.



Significant perf deltas:

- nested-subgrid

avg 182.38 runs/s -> 259.552 runs/s (42.3% better)



Bug: 1505606

entry.title: Delete unused UnitsPerEm code in Blink Font{Data,Metrics}
entry.content:
blink::FontMetrics has a field to store the UnitsPerEm value, along with

a getter and a setter. Since the only caller to the getter in

blink::SimpleFontData is dead code, all of this is dead code.

Transitively remove all the dead code here.

entry.title: Add a NetLog event for HostResolverInternalResults extraction
entry.content:
Existing events only record the final synthesized HostCache::Entries.

Having a separate event per DNS response is helpful, especially

when we try to make connection attempts without waiting for all

responses.



Also rename existing events from HOST_RESOLVER_MANAGER_DNS_TASK_*

to HOST_RESOLVER_DNS_TASK for consistency.



Bug: chromium:1520720

entry.title: Sync prefs: Make kCommonSyncablePrefsAllowlist constexpr
entry.content:
Before this CL, kCommonSyncablePrefsAllowlist was created via

MakeFixedFlatMapNonConsteval, which is discouraged since it does

sorting at runtime. Instead, MakeFixedFlatMap should be used which

does the sorting at compile time, but requires all the inputs to be

constexpr. That was done in various precursor CLs to this one, so now

we can switch to MakeFixedFlatMap.



Bug: 1512537

entry.title: Return JavaScriptError for unreachable node
entry.content:
Until this commit ChromeDriver used to return StaleElementReference

if the node returned by a script belonged to a different frame.

This behavior was not standard compliant. This commit fixes this error.

Now ChromeDriver returns JavaScriptError in this case.

> Add MemoryTaggingBootloaderOverride synthetic finch group

entry.title: Warm-up service worker on idle timeout
entry.content:
Before this CL, whenever the service worker stops, the service worker

automatically warms up unconditionally. This CL changes this

behavior. After this CL, the service worker will warm up only when the

worker stops with idle timeout.



Bug: 1431792

entry.title: Add 'URL Protocol' key for custom protocols scheme on Windows
entry.content:
When a developer attempts to register a custom protocol scheme via

registerProtocolHandler protocol, we attempt to register the custom

protocol scheme with the operating system. On Windows, we need to add

a registry key 'URL Protocol' with an empty string value to declares a

this is a custom pluggable protocol handler. Without this key, the handler application will not launch.



See https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/windows/internet-explorer/ie-developer/platform-apis/aa767914(v=vs.85)?redirectedfrom=MSDN#registering-the-application-handling-the-custom-uri-scheme for details.



Additionally, after creating the registry keys, we also need to call

SHChangeNotify to notify the system of the newly added custom protocol.



Tested via:



1) Navigate to https://protocol-handler.glitch.me/ and click the "Register protocol handler" button.

2) Navigate to https://protocol-handler-link.glitch.me/ and click the "Chai" link. That should open a link to https://protocol-handler.glitch.me/?tea=web%2Btea%3A%2F%2Fchai



Bug: 1476879

Change-Id: Iae2417deeb90d2a97b2f29ce561f169fee578997

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4903305

Reviewed-by: Greg Thompson

Commit-Queue: Mike Jackson

entry.title: Support large grid items layout in PickerSectionView.
entry.content:
Add large grid items container which lays out items in two equal width

columns. When an item is added to the grid, it is added to the shorter

of the two columns (preferring the left column when there is a tie).



This large items grid layout will be used for gifs. Follow up will add a

small items grid layout for emojis and symbols.



Bug: b:321109956

based on the bootloader_override property.

https://android.googlesource.com/platform/packages/apps/Settings/+/refs/heads/main/src/com/android/settings/security/MemtagHelper.java



The bootloader_override property will be set on dogfood devices via an

bootloader_override property will be shared between personal/corp

profiles, so we will be able to tell dogfood devices this wy.

When clearing found devices (triggered by freshness check), we don't

remove devices which are paired. However, we still tell the observers

that those device are removed.



This CL fixes the inconsistency to not tell the observers if we don't

entry.title: [Files F2] Fix "navigate away from Drive" logic when it's disabled
entry.content:
This is a reland of CL:5208670 together with an integration test.



A fake drive item is displayed on the directory tree before the

prefs is retrieved, when prefs shows drive should be disabled,

we should navigate away from Drive if it's the current active

directory.



This CL fixes the logic in navigateAwayFromDisabledRoot_ function

to use entry as input parameter so it works both for the old tree

and the new tree.



Demo: http://go/scrcast/NjU1MDIwOTM2MTM0NjU2MHxkZWVlNDZjNi0yMw

entry.title: Bugfix: Stop the warmed-up service worker correctly
entry.content:
Before this CL, when the warmed-up service worker is requested to stop,

the service worker surprisingly starts instead of stopping. This CL

fixes this bug.



The bug was located in the ServiceWorkerVersion. Before this CL,

start_callbacks_ contained remaining callbacks while the service worker

was warming up or warmed up. These remaining callbacks are checked in

ServiceWorkerVersion::OnStoppedInternal() like the following.



bool should_restart = !start_callbacks_.empty();



The should_restart flag becomes true, and the service worker is

restarted. This CL fixes this problem by flushing callbacks beforehand.



Bug: 1431792

Change-Id: Id9a6f143ab7c93178f7183e6ed0509c486dda9c2

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5224881

Reviewed-by: Yoshisato Yanagisawa

entry.title: Bundz: add handle scope for streamed string and update comment
entry.content:
In the previous test, we didn't cover the case that `console.log` the

incomplete streaming output half way. Doing so will trigger a crash

which should be the real reason why some demos failed.



This CL adds the handle scope for that to resolve the issue. It also

updates a TODO comment as mentioned in the previous code review.

entry.title: [OOPIF PDF] Deprecate TestPdfViewerStreamManager::WaitUntilPdfLoaded()
entry.content:
Change WaitUntilPdfLoaded() to DeprecateWaitUntilPdfLoaded(). A new

version of WaitUntilPdfLoaded() will be added in

https://crrev.com/c/5218535 that fully waits for the PDF to load, not

just wait until after the PDF content frame navigates. This is needed

for some tests that must wait until all PDF content is loaded.

entry.title: Make SharedImageInterface refcounted
entry.content:
This CL makes SharedImageInterface thread-safe refcounted, and replaces

all SharedImageInterface `unique_ptr`s with `scoped_reptr`s accordingly.



This CL is a prerequisite for allowing ClientSharedImage's destructor

to invoke SharedImageInterface::DestroySharedImage().

entry.title: a11y: Don't announce RA player as if it's a button
entry.content:
The click target that opens the expanded player is different from the

overall player layout. Both are announced as buttons while only the

former should be.



I couldn't find a way to have "'Listen to this page' player" announced

for the layout without "double tap to activate", so I removed the

label altogether so that only the expand player click target is

announced.

entry.content:

Reason for revert: Speculative fix for b/321322263



Original change's description:

> Migrate ToastManager's SystemToastStyle usages to new SystemToastView

>

> https://goto.google.com/system-toast-view

>

> Use the new SystemToastView added in http://crrev/c/4894945 to be used

> by the ToastOverlay object created through the ToastManager.

>

> Using this new view fixes an issue with the current SystemToastStyle

> view where the shadows go out of bounds.

> screenshot comparisons old vs. new component:

> one-line: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/8ru3aj5mEUPzAiT

> - Pass the `toast_data` parameter from ToastManager instead of sending

> every contained parameter individually.

> - Added `ToggleA11yFocus` and related member variables and functions to

> SystemToastView to match behavior implemented in http://crrev/c/3692579.

>

entry.title: arc: Call CancelPress() before dispatching an event to an underlying Widget
entry.content:
Dispatching a scroll event might cause a close event which results

in deleting the ArcNotificationItem.

In that case, the following call of |owner_->item_->CancelPress()|

crashes by use-after-free.

entry.title: Speculatively fix race in mojo ShutDownOnIOThread
entry.content:
This acquires `write_lock_` before resetting handles used by WriteNoLock

(which is called under the same lock in another thread). We also set

`reject_writes_` to prevent future write attempts after shutdown. That

seems strictly more correct.



We also acquire `fds_to_close_lock_` before clearing the FDs.



I was unable to repro locally as content_browsertests just times out

in my local setup without reporting anything interesting. This seems

strictly more correct though.



Bug: 1519980

entry.title: [Start] Use a SolidColorSceneLayer
entry.content:
During the transition between Start Surface and Hub there is sometimes

a white flash on the screen. Part of the cause is that Start Surface

has a white background SceneLayer and can take 1-2 frames to layout.

This causes a white flash on the screen.



Fix this by making the SceneLayer show the intended background color

of Start.

entry.title: [Nearby Share] Update NS Settings string
entry.content:
Updates the settings strings to shown in the Connected devices

settings page when NS is off or disabled. The new strings provide

a link for users to learn more about NS in both cases. When

NS is off, instead of saying 'Off', now the page gives a description

of NS



The new strings to be used are those used regardless of whether

os-settings-revamp-wayfinding

was enabled: before, there were different strings used if enabled.



For this reason, the code conditioning the strings shown on

the flag state are removed.



Before

--------------------------------------------

Revamp Wayfinding: Disabled

---------------------------

NS: Disabled

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/9h3h4asJdppdQyN.png



NS: On

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/A7hPyFKheYEXJGC.png



NS: Off

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/7H5j9DMHtF4ukKR.png



Revamp Wayfinding: Enabled

--------------------------

NS: Disabled

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/AxvUQjCn3gRGbvx.png



NS: On

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/7RJ839YD9qHYEUB.png



NS: Off

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/8hFo8wfnLYBo2QP.png





After

--------------------------------------------

Revamp Wayfinding: Disabled

---------------------------

NS: Disabled

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/7sBPs2sYXG6cAgJ.png



NS: On

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/AVMHa5wB5SQQWJS.png



NS: Off

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/8UhLxpgxP8nbYwg.png



Revamp Wayfinding: Enabled

--------------------------

NS: Disabled

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/GcYddhTztfiUKFT.png



NS: On

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/BYfthDJBHaJ6Zru.png



NS: Off

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/32km8jNyMfkAiP2.png



Visibility strings for all visibilities when NS is enabled

appear as expected; because none were changed, screenshots

above of NS enabled and on show a device set to 'All contacts'

visibility.



Tested: all unit tests in browser_tests pass.

Fixed: b/316389476

Change-Id: Iaa05067078e1e85d7ff5102a80949d1d6b9f1279

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5208313

entry.title: Set input_coded_size_ as the actual encode size.
entry.content:
Some encoders only work with an aligned resolution, so the actual encode

size could be different from the requested size.



CL 4686192[1] moved input_coded_size_ assignment from

RequireBitstreamBuffers to InitializeOnAcceleratorThread and

ChangeOptionsOnAcceleratorThread because bitstream buffer is possible to

be reused when resolution is changed. However, the latest patchset[2]

requires VEA implementations must call RequireBitstreamBuffers when

frame size changes, even existing buffer can be reused. Therefore, it's

safe to move input_coded_size_ assignment back to

RequireBitstreamBuffers.



[1] https://crrev.com/c/4686192

[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/video/video_encode_accelerator.h;drc=76b8214a551d43dd94a1e88f8a7d2424dc507ba7;l=424



Bug: 1520391, 1466102

Change-Id: Ibbcdba2a0bad715d35ec122439f7b295b8f60cb2

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5221906

entry.title: [a11y] SetSelection bug in <textarea>
entry.content:
A bug was found where a selection was sent from the browser process

with the following html:







The selection was sent from the browser process to be on the

inlineTextBox for "text go blue" with offsets 0,4. It was then

expected for the selection to be "text". However,

the selection would be set on "hell".



This was because we had some logic in AXSelection::Select

that assumed that the start and end offsets were relative to the

atomic text field root, and so the selection was being placed on

offsets 0,4 but on the text field root.



I've added a check so that we only fall down this logic if the

selection's base and extent containers are the text field root.



Change-Id: I76bdd8cec020cb6a55a204cc94caed2d56ed987f

entry.title: [Extensions] Fix non-lazy background metric description.
entry.content:
This is a no-op code change, but helps cleanup some metrics data on the

server side.



Before this change we accidentally auto-synthesized these two metrics

from histograms.xml due to how we used the variants/pattern, but they

were never emitted and are irrelevant:



Extensions.Events.DispatchToAckTime.ExtensionPersistentBackgroundPage.Inactive

Extensions.Events.DispatchToAckTime.ExtensionPersistentBackgroundPage.Active



Persistent/non-lazy background context are always active so they don't

need separate metric emits.



After this change the metric is in its own stanza so only

Extensions.Events.DispatchToAckTime.ExtensionPersistentBackgroundPage

will be emitted going forward.



Also removes BackgroundContextType variants stanza since it's only used

in one place.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=Patterned histogram ExtensionPersistentBackgroundPage.Inactive/.Active will never be emitted so it is obsoleted.



Bug: 1441221

entry.title: Don't run module shims before kernel32 gets loaded
entry.content:
There are several bugs with the sandbox shims, root caused as chromium

sometimes accessing the Windows heap before it is safe to do so, when

OS code attempts to call NtCreateSection or NtMapViewOfSection during

super-early process start-up.



NtCreateSection - used to bypass CIG checks for binaries not signed by

Microsoft by brokering the syscall.



NtMapViewOfSection - used to listen to DLL loads in case we want to

also shim those DLLs.



This change adds early exits to the shims when these APIs are called

before kernel32 is loaded, to avoid needing to use the heap while the

process is in this super-early startup phase. There is not a great

publicly documented API we can use earlier, as Windows public API is

generally in kernel32, ntdll is mostly undocumented.



It should be safe to wait this long. For NtCreateSection because all

the Chromium binaries depend on kernel32.dll For NtMapViewOfSection

because kernel32.dll should get loaded before any other DLLs we try to

shim at runtime.



Verified manually with a smoke test that we can run chromium under

page heap and under the conditions from crbug.com/1519187



Bug: 1519187, 465515, 1004989

Change-Id: Ia7bbf04912238a814cdeca4eace810b2509dcc69

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5214980

Reviewed-by: Alex Gough

entry.title: Revert "Add crash keys to VulkanSwapChain"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 1d83694ad09848526fca458ef4eb6b4739174ad5.



Reason for revert: Thread-unsafe use of crash keys.



The crash keys are shared across threads and without external

synchronization this does data race. It looks like the investigated

crbug.com/1246857 has been fixed, so hopefully it's not too bad to

remove this before we have crash primitives that are safe to use in this

manner.



Bug: 1509041



Original change's description:

> Add crash keys to VulkanSwapChain

>

> We speculate that vkQueuePresentKHR and vkAcquireNextImageKHR

> occasionally block and GPU process gets killed by GPU watchdog.

>

> This CL adds crash keys to determine if this happens.

>

entry.title: Set `disable_cert_network_fetches` in ConnectJobFactory.
entry.content:
Also make it a part of the ClientSocketPool::GroupID. This protects

against mixing sockets with it set and it not set, which could have

surprising results, and break things. We do already avoid this situation

by having the one consumer that disables these fatches (The PAC script

fetches) use its own unique transient NIK, but that's not a robust

protection, and requires us pooling requests with different SSLConfigs,

which have a lot of other fields that could vary, again causing

breakages.



`disable_cert_network_fetches` should also be added to H2 and H3

SessionKeys, which will be done in followup CLs.



This is part of an effort to remove SSLConfig as a parameter to

ConnectJobFactory, and instead create it there.



Bug: 1498285

entry.title: [a11y] NextOnLine/PreviousOnLine computation changes
entry.content:
This CL makes some changes to the NextOnLine/PreviousOnLine

computations. There was a bug where if we had a structure as follows:



first line


this is broken

last line






Where ATs like Narrator and NVDA would have incorrect behavior

by not reading out "this line is broken" when moving by line.

They would only read part of the line, as internally we were treating

this structure as two separate lines, even though visually they're

in the same line.



The way we now fix this on the renderer side is the following:



1) We now include elements that are inline block in the

accessibility tree, in cases where they otherwise would not have been

included.



2) Previously, when computing the NextOnLine/PreviousOnLine, we

would always "drill down" to the deepest included AX child. This

causes the issue since inline block elements have their own

inline formatting contexts, and so when drilling down, the

InlineTextBox for "is" would have no next on line element according

to the inline cursor. Now, we stop drilling down as soon as we find an

element that is inline block. So the NextOnLine element for "this "

ends up being the generic container that is marked as inline block,

and furthermore, the generic container that is marked as inline block

has a NextOnLine, which in this case would be "broken".



On the browser side there are two fixes that needed to be made to

take into account the render side changes:



1) Since we mostly deal with leaf text positions in AXPosition,

for the example outlined above we would be in a state where we are

in the InlineTextBox for "is" and as we discussed above, that

element has no NextOnLine. Thus, we now bubble up to find the

parent's NextOnLine, because we could be in a situation where the

InlineTextBox we are currently at is within an inline block container

that does in fact now have a NextOnLine.



2) On the TextRangeProvider side, we had a condition where we were

treating inline block elements as the start of a new line. This was

removed since it was concluded that this is incorrect, since visually

they are on the same line.



There is still another bug to follow up on where NVDA and Narrator

get stuck after reading the second line in the outlined test case.

This happens both with the fix and without the fix. This has been

filed here: https://crbug.com/1517948.



AX-Relnotes: Adding support for nested line formatting contexts.





Change-Id: I80f0dcd03ddcb115f11ac8e9c340a4dd1d55d7e4

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5177314

Reviewed-by: Benjamin Beaudry

Commit-Queue: Javier Contreras

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1250525}

entry.title: `span`-ify around `components/subresource_filter/.../indexed_ruleset.cc`
entry.content:
This CL starts by tweaking the `LocalGetChecksum` function in

`components/subresource_filter/core/common/indexed_ruleset.cc` to accept

a `base::span` parameter instead of a pointer+size pair.

This change is motivated by the desire to `span`-ify the

`base::PersistentHash` function (i.e. to eventually remove the overload

taking pointer+size pair).



The remainder of the CL makes additional follow-up changes needed to

ensure that the code still compiles (i.e. we need to use `base::span` in

a few other places).



This CL is meant to have no impact on behavior. And therefore there

should be no need to update `RulesetIndexer::kIndexedFormatVersion`.



Change-Id: Ie6fa3d13a09412e33941d0f1fba6452924909c9b

entry.title: media: Fix ParseDolbyVisionCodecId() checking
entry.content:
In IsSupportedMediaType() in key_system_config_selector.cc, a codec

should be removed when it's a DolbyVision codec. But this logic was

reverted when we refactor video codec string parsing in

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5147987/12/third_party/blink/renderer/platform/media/key_system_config_selector.cc



This CL reverted it back.



Fixed: 1519858

entry.title: [IdleTimeout] Reload pages when ClearBrowsingDataAction clears site data
entry.content:
IdleTimeout "clear_cookies_and_other_site_data" should reload pages

to sign out users from sites. Web usage is disabled right before data

is cleared and re-enabled when clearing is done.
